transcripts.text: You were sort of one of the stars of the inauguration.  Were you aware that this photo became the meme of the day?
Not at all.  I was just sitting there trying to keep warm, trying to pay attention to what was going on.
I appreciate that you're not a politician who uses memes, but you became one.  I mean, do you... Does your staff show them to you?  Here you are with the Sex and the City girls.

Yeah, I've seen them.  What was really nice, Seth, is the woman who made the mittens lives in Essex Junction, Vermont.  She is a schoolteacher and is a very, very nice person, and she has been somewhat overwhelmed by the kind of attention that is being shown to her mittens.

You know, she struck me as the kind of supporter who would make Bernie Sanders mittens because I read her saying that a lot of people have reached out asking for the mittens, and she basically said, look, I work.  I'm a mother.  I don't have time to make you mittens.  And I thought that is very in line with what I expect of you as well, all business.  And I promise, I promise to get to a substantive discussion here.  I don't want to waste all the time talking about memes.  But the other question, of course, is people were asking what you were carrying.  What was your manila envelope?
I'd love to tell you a top secret.
You know, I think this is my favorite one because I just don't think you would listen to Forrest Gump that long.  I think you would get up and leave that bench.
